The products are manufactured by [[McNeil Consumer Healthcare]] company, a subsidiary of [[Johnson & Johnson]].<ref name="ny" /> [[GlaxoSmithKline]] is the licence holder of Nicorette gum in the [[United States]] while [[Johnson & Johnson]] markets Nicorette globally.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2014-02-19/glaxo-memo-shows-drug-industry-lobbying-on-e-cigarettes.html |title=Glaxo Memo Shows Drug Industry Lobbying on E-Cigarettes |last1=Kitamura |first1=Makiko |date=2014-02-19 |year= |website= |series= |publisher=[[Bloomberg News]] |location= |page= |pages= |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6V5HXioi9?url=http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2014-02-19/glaxo-memo-shows-drug-industry-lobbying-on-e-cigarettes.html |archivedate=2014-12-25 |accessdate=2014-12-25 |quote= |ref= |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
Nicotine replacement products including gum and [[transdermal patch]]es are on the [[WHO Model List of Essential Medicines]].<ref> {{cite web |url=http://www.who.int/medicines/publications/essentialmedicines/18th_EML.pdf |title=WHO Model List of Essential Medicines 18th list (April 2013) (Final Amendments – October 2013) |date= |year=2013 |website= |series= |publisher=[[World Health Organization]] |location= |page= |pages= |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6V5X5bFS9?url=http://www.who.int/medicines/publications/essentialmedicines/18th_EML.pdf |archivedate=2014-12-25 |accessdate=2014-12-25 |quote= |ref= |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
The brand name "Nicorette" comes from "nicotine" and {{lang-sv|rette}}, "right way".<ref name="Swedish" />
== Medical uses == Nicorette products are indicated for the relief of [[Drug withdrawal|withdrawal symptoms]] associated with [[nicotine withdrawal]] and to aid in [[smoking cessation]].<ref name="mhrapatch">{{cite web|url=http://www.mhra.gov.uk/home/groups/l-unit1/documents/websiteresources/con036311.pdf |title=Nicorette Invisi 10 mg patch, Nicorette Invisi 15 mg patch, Nicorette Invisi 25 mg patch, PL 15513/0159-61 |date=2008-12-02 |year= |website= |series= |publisher=[[Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency]] |location= |page= |pages= |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6VRov0Vk6?url=http://www.mhra.gov.uk/home/groups/l-unit1/documents/websiteresources/con036311.pdf |archivedate=2015-01-09 |accessdate=2015-01-09 |quote= |ref= |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> It is suggested that Nicorette products should be used in "conjunction with a behavioural support programme".<ref name="mhrapatch" />
Prior to 2005 nicotine products in Britain were only licensed to "assist smokers who were making an immediate and complete quit attempt".<ref name="mhrarep">{{cite web|url=http://www.mhra.gov.uk/home/groups/es-policy/documents/publication/con068571.pdf |title=MHRA Public Assessment Report: The use of nicotine replacement therapy to reduce harm in smokers, February 2010 |date= |year=2010 |website= |series= |publisher=[[Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency]] |location= |page= |pages= |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6VRpgDPgn?url=http://www.mhra.gov.uk/home/groups/es-policy/documents/publication/con068571.pdf |archivedate=2015-01-09 |accessdate=2015-01-09 |quote= |ref= |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Following advice from a working group set up by the [[Committee on Safety of Medicines]] (since 2005 the [[Commission on Human Medicines]]) the [[Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency|MHRA]] concluded that NRT products should be used also by those who are unable to stop abruptly.<ref name="mhrarep" />
Currently Nicorette products in the UK are indicated to: * relieve craving (the urge to smoke), * relieve withdrawal symptoms ([[irritability]], impatience; difficulty in concentrating), * improve the likelihood of a successful abrupt quit attempt, * reduce the amount smoked in those not immediately motivated to quit.<ref name="mhrarep" />
The products are intended for adults and children over 12 years of age as well as pregnant and lactating women<ref name="mhragum">{{cite web|url=http://www.mhra.gov.uk/home/groups/l-unit1/documents/websiteresources/con2024562.pdf |title=Nicorette Peppermint 2 and 4 mg gum, Nicorette Ice Mint 2 and 4 mg gum, Nicorette Spearmint 2 and 4 mg gum, PL 15513/0136-7, PL 15513/0143-4, PL 15513/0152-3 |date=2006-07-18 |website= |series= |publisher=[[Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency]] |location= |page= |pages= |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6VRs0AJVx?url=http://www.mhra.gov.uk/home/groups/l-unit1/documents/websiteresources/con2024562.pdf |archivedate=2015-01-09 |accessdate=2015-01-09 |quote= |ref= |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> (it has been concluded that "the use of NRT in pregnancy does not give undue concern and any harm caused by nicotine replacement must be compared with that caused by continued smoking – which is extremely harmful to both the woman and her child".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mhra.gov.uk/home/groups/pl-a/documents/websiteresources/con2023239.pdf|title=Report of the Committee on Safety of Medicines Working Group on Nicotine Replacement Therapy, November 2005|date=|year=2005|website=|series=|publisher=[[Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency]]|location=|page=|pages=|accessdate=2015-01-09|quote=|ref=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101214073332/http://www.mhra.gov.uk/home/groups/pl-a/documents/websiteresources/con2023239.pdf|archivedate=2010-12-14|df=}}</ref>)
Nicorette, like all other NRT products, are most beneficial for heavy smokers (more than 15 cigarettes per day). There are not enough studies to show that NRT helps those who smoke fewer than 10 cigarettes per day.<ref>{{cite web|title=Nicotine replacement therapy|url=https://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/ency/article/007438.htm|author=David C. Dugdale, III|website=MedlinePlus|publisher=U.S. National Library of Medicine|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20150109145356/http://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/ency/article/007438.htm|archivedate=2015-01-09|accessdate=2015-01-09}}</ref>
== Contraindications == The typical contraindication (reason to not use) for Nicorette products is hypersensitivity to nicotine.<ref name="mhrapatch" /><ref name="mhragum" />
Up until recently [[cardiovascular disease]] was considered to be a contraindication to nicotine replacement therapy products. However, in 2003 the French Agency for the Safety of Health Products ([[Agence française de sécurité sanitaire des produits de santé|AFSSAPS]]) removed all cardiovascular and cerebrovascular disease contraindications. In 2005 the UK Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency followed suit. The rationale is that the benefit of nicotine replacement therapy outweighs the risks of nicotine medication, even in smokers with cardiovascular disease.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.treatobacco.net/en/page_75.php |title=Nicotine is not a significant risk factor for cardiovascular events. The benefit of nicotine replacement therapy outweighs the risks of nicotine medication, even in smokers with cardiovascular disease |date=2014-12-16 |year= |website= |series= |publisher=The Society for Research on Nicotine and Tobacco (SRNT) |location= |page= |pages= |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6VS8mg6s8?url=http://www.treatobacco.net/en/page_75.php |archivedate=2015-01-09 |accessdate=2015-01-09 |quote= |ref= |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
In 2013 the US [[Food and Drug Administration|FDA]] stated that the contraindication concerning usage of NRT products while smoking is no longer valid.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fda.gov/ForConsumers/ConsumerUpdates/ucm345087.htm |title=Nicotine Replacement Therapy Labels May Change |date=2013-04-01 |year= |website= |series= |publisher=[[Food and Drug Administration]] |location= |page= |pages= |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6VS9Rf1u1?url=http://www.fda.gov/ForConsumers/ConsumerUpdates/ucm345087.htm |archivedate=2015-01-09 |accessdate=2015-01-09 |quote= |ref= |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
The FDA approved [[Packaging and labeling|labeling]] for Nicorette products with a warning concerning [[pregnancy]] and [[breastfeeding]]: "This medicine is believed to be safer than smoking. However, the risks to your child from this medicine are not fully known".<ref name="fdagum">{{cite web|url=http://www.accessdata.fda.gov/drugsatfda_docs/label/2014/018612Orig1s074,%20020066Orig1s055lbl.pdf |title=Nicorette, Nicotine Polacrilex, Labeling Revision 10/30/2014 |date=2014-10-30 |year= |website= |series= |publisher=[[Food and Drug Administration]] |location= |page= |pages= |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6VSDayYiZ?url=http://www.accessdata.fda.gov/drugsatfda_docs/label/2014/018612Orig1s074,%20020066Orig1s055lbl.pdf |archivedate=2015-01-09 |accessdate=2015-01-09 |quote= |ref= |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> The FDA suggests not using Nicorette products if the patient continues to smoke, or use chewing tobacco, snuff or other nicotine-containing products.<ref name="fdagum" />
The FDA advises consulting a doctor before using the product if the patient previously had: * heart disease, recent heart attack, or irregular heartbeat, * high blood pressure, * taken a prescription medicine for depression or asthma. Specific contraindications listed by the FDA for various formats include sodium-restricted diet, stomach ulcer of diabetes (for gums<ref name="fdagum" /> and lozenges), or an allergy to adhesive tape or skin problems (for patches).<ref name="fdapatch">{{cite web|url=http://www.accessdata.fda.gov/drugsatfda_docs/label/2014/020165Orig1s029lbl.pdf |title=Nicoderm, Labeling Revision 10/30/2014 |date=2014-04-30 |year= |website= |series= |publisher=[[Food and Drug Administration]] |location= |page= |pages= |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6VSF7rGmn?url=http://www.accessdata.fda.gov/drugsatfda_docs/label/2014/020165Orig1s029lbl.pdf |archivedate=2015-01-09 |accessdate=2015-01-09 |quote= |ref= |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
The FDA suggests stopping use of Nicorette products in cases of irregular heartbeat or palpitations, symptoms of nicotine overdose ([[nausea]], [[vomiting]], dizziness, weakness, and rapid heartbeat)<ref name="fdagum" /> or skin redness caused by the patch.<ref name="fdapatch" />
== Formats ==
=== Gum ===
Nicorette chewing gum releases nicotine while chewing. Nicotine then is absorbed across the [[oral mucosa]] into the [[systemic circulation]]. Patients are advised to chew the gum slowly and intermittently to avoid the risk of releasing too much nicotine. It is also suggested not to eat or drink while chewing since foods and beverages can reduce nicotine absorption.<ref name="lehne">{{cite book|last1= Burchum|first1=Jacqueline|last2= Rosenthal|first2=Laura|year=2014|chapter=Chapter 39: Drug Abuse III: Nicotine and Smoking |title= Lehne's Pharmacology for Nursing Care|edition=|page=427|publisher=Elsevier Health Sciences |isbn=0323340261|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=C7_NBQAAQBAJ&pg=PA427&dq#v=onepage&q&f=false|accessdate=2015-01-18}}(Google Books)</ref>
Nicorette chewing gum is available in two strengths: 2 mg/piece and 4 mg/piece. Dosing would depend on the degree of nicotine dependence: light smokers should use 2 mg gum, heavy smokers (more than 25 cigarettes a day) should use 4 mg gum.<ref name="lehne" /> Patients should chew gum once they feel the craving. The average adult dosage is 9 to 12 pieces per day.<ref name="lehne" /> FDA limits maximum daily amount of 2 mg gums to 24 pieces.<ref name="fdagum" />
It is suggested to use gum following a 12-week schedule, reducing the amount of gums consumed by the end of the therapy.<ref name="fdagum" />
=== Patch === The patches provide slow absorption of nicotine into blood within the day and work for 16 hours.<ref name="rutter">{{cite book|last=Rutter|first=Paul| year=2013|chapter=Nicorette |title= Community Pharmacy: Symptoms, Diagnosis and Treatment|edition=3|page=320|publisher=Elsevier Health Sciences |isbn=0702054739|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=1_mI_n3y5koC&pg=PA320&dq=#v=onepage&q&f=false|accessdate=2015-01-18}}(Google Books)</ref> They are usually applied in the morning and removed at bedtime.
The patch supports smoking cessation within 12 week programme: 25 mg patch (25 mg nicotine over 16 hours) for eight weeks (Step 1), 15 mg patch for two weeks (Step 2), 10 mg patch for the last two weeks (Step 3). Light smokers (less than 10 cigarettes per day) were recommended to start at Step 2 (15 mg) for eight weeks and reduce the dose to 10 mg for the last four weeks.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mims.co.uk/more/NewDrugs/article/892146/New-high-strength-nicotine-patch/ |title=New high-strength nicotine patch |date=2009-02-24 |year= |website= |series= |publisher=[[Monthly Index of Medical Specialities]] |location= |page= |pages= |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6VECO3ecd?url=http://m.mims.co.uk/article/892146/new-high-strength-nicotine-patch |archivedate=2014-12-31 |accessdate=2014-12-31 |quote= |ref= |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
=== Microtab === Microtab supplies nicotine to the body by mouth. It is different from the chewing gum because instead of chewing the patient should allow the tablet to dissolve slowly under the tongue (the tablet dissolves in about 20-30 [[minute]]s).<ref name="stop">{{cite book|last=Willis|first=Nicola| year=2012|chapter=Which Treatment?|title=Stop! No Smoking Programme |edition=|page=69|publisher=Random House|isbn=1448148952}}</ref> The action is similar to 2 mg nicotine gum.<ref name="stop" />
Microtabs are used either for smoking cessation or smoking reduction. For smoking cessation the standard dose is one tablet (2 mg) per hour for patients who smoke less than 20 cigarettes per day. When the craving is strong two tablets can be taken instead of one. Most patients require between 8 and 24 tablets per day.<ref name="rutter" /> British [[Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency]] recommends not to exceed 40 tablets per day limit.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mhra.gov.uk/home/groups/par/documents/websiteresources/con054754.pdf |title=Public Assessment Report: Nicorette Microtab Lemon 2mg sublingual tablets. Nicotine bitartrate dihydrate, PL 15513/0156 |date=2009-06-30 |year= |website= |series= |publisher=[[Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency]] |location= |page= |pages= |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Vg7lasik?url=http://www.mhra.gov.uk/home/groups/par/documents/websiteresources/con054754.pdf |archivedate=2015-01-18 |accessdate=2015-01-18 |quote= |ref= |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Treatment should be stopped when daily consumption is around 1-2 tablets per day.<ref name="rutter" />
=== Spray === [[File:Nicorette QuickMist Spray.jpg|thumb|Nicorette spray at the pharmacy (France)]] A spray of nicotine is available.<ref name=Spray2014>{{cite journal|title=Nicotine Replacement Therapy for Smoking Cessation or Reduction: A Review of the Clinical Evidence|date=16 January 2014|pmid=24741730}}</ref> Tentative evidence supports that it is better than a placebo.<ref name=Spray2014/> MHRA suggests not to use more than 2 sprays at a time, up to 4 sprays per hour and no more than 64 sprays per 24 hours period.<ref name="quickm" />
== History ==
=== Nicotine gum ===
The Nicorette brand started with a [[nicotine chewing gum]] developed in [[Helsingborg]] ([[Sweden]]) by the company Leo AB, later part of [[Pharmacia|Pharmacia & Upjohn]]. It was the first product for [[nicotine replacement therapy]]<ref name="inmemo" /> and gained its inventor, Ove Fernö, titles like "the founding father of modern pharmacotherapy for smoking".<ref>{{cite book |last=West|first=Robert|editor1-last=Edwards|editor1-first= Griffith|date=|year=2008|chapter=Pillars of Smoke|title= Addiction: Evolution of a Specialist Field |edition=1st|page=231| publisher= John Wiley & Sons|isbn=1405147504|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=eNdhgma5KpwC&pg=PA231&lpg=PA231&dq=#v=onepage&q&f=false|accessdate=2015-01-05}}(Google Books)</ref>
On December 12, 1967,<ref>{{cite book|last=Raw|first=Martin |date=|year=2012|chapter=Who invented NRT|title=How To Stop Smoking And Stay Stopped|edition=1st|page=79| publisher=Random House|isbn=1446417883|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=jK2ZSCvg7L0C&pg=PT79&dq=#v=onepage&q&f=false}}</ref><ref name="wiley">{{cite journal|url=http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/j.1360-0443.1994.tb03300.x/pdf |title=JOURNAL INTERVIEW—35: Conversation with Ove Ferno |date= |year=1994 |location= |pages=1215–1226 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6VL8ufeJx?url=http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/j.1360-0443.1994.tb03300.x/pdf |archivedate=2015-01-04 |accessdate=2015-01-05 |quote= |ref= |deadurl=yes |df= |doi=10.1111/j.1360-0443.1994.tb03300.x |volume=89 |issue=10 |journal=Addiction}}</ref>{{rp|1216}} Fernö, Vice President of Research and Development at AB Leo,<ref name="wiley" />{{rp|1215}} received a mail from his friend Dr. Claes Lundgren at the Department of Aviation Medicine at the Physiological Institute of [[University of Lund|Lund University]], suggesting he develop an orally consumed substitute for tobacco. He and his colleague Stefan Lichtneckert noted how submariners and aviation crews switched from [[cigarette]]s to [[chewing tobacco]] and [[snus]] when smoking was not possible. They also suggested the product name "Nicorette".<ref name="Swedish">{{cite book |last1=Larsson|first1=Bengt|last2=Letell|first2=Martin|last3= Thörn|first3=Håkan|year=2012|chapter=9.5 The rise of medicinal nicotine in Sweden |title= Transformations of the Swedish Welfare State: From Social Engineering to Governance?|edition=1st|page=| publisher=Palgrave Macmillan |isbn=0230363954|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=fU1dAQAAQBAJ&pg=PA145&dq=#v=onepage&q&f=false}}</ref>{{rp|145}} Fernö began experimenting with nicotine gum in 1969 and quit smoking himself after one year of use.<ref name="wiley" />{{rp|1218}}
The first nicotine chewing gum was produced at AB Leo in 1971. The innovation was in the use of [[ion-exchange resin]] ([[Nicotine polacrilex|polacrilex]]) in order to control the rate of release of nicotine during chewing. Fernö explained, "Putting nicotine into chewing gum is not an invention. Fixing the nicotine to an ion exchange resin and putting that in a chewing gum to enable the chewer to control the rate of release—that is an invention".<ref name="wiley" />{{rp|1220}} The same year Håkan Westling, Professor of Clinical Physiology at Lund University, started the first clinical trials of the gum as an aid to smoking cessation at the university hospital. His findings were presented at the Second World Conference on Smoking and Health in London<ref name="Swedish" />{{rp|146}} and were published in 1973 in the journal ''Psychopharmacologia'' together with an article by Fernö.<ref>{{cite journal|vauthors=Brantmark B, Ohlin P, Westling H | date = 1973-07-19| title = Nicotine-containing chewing gum as an anti-smoking aid.| url = | journal = Psychopharmacologia| publisher = | volume = 31| issue = 3| pages = 191–200| doi = 10.1007/bf00422509| pmc = | pmid = 4581737}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal| author = Fernö O.| date = 1973-07-19| title = A substitute for tobacco smoking.| url = | journal = Psychopharmacologia| publisher = | volume = 31| issue = 3| pages = 201–204| doi = | pmc = | pmid = 4732726}}</ref>
Nicotine chewing gum was presented at the Third World Conference on Smoking and Health in New York in 1975 by Fernö in partnership with the British researcher Michael Russell from the [[Institute of Psychiatry]], who pioneered the measurement of blood nicotine levels. Russell and his colleagues at the Addiction Research Unit at the Institute of Psychiatry became involved in further research into nicotine gum through randomised controlled trials funded by the British Medical Research Council and the UK [[Department of Health and Social Security]].<ref name="Swedish" />{{rp|147}}
Nicorette was registered as a drug in Switzerland in 1978, in Canada in 1979, and in the UK in 1980.<ref name="Swedish" />{{rp|147}} It was registered in Sweden in 1981. Initially the Swedish [[Medical Products Agency (Sweden)|Medical Products Agency]] declined to approve Nicorette as a medicine because it considered smoking not an addiction, but a lifestyle choice; and the Swedish [[National Board of Health and Welfare (Sweden)|National Board of Health and Welfare]] regarded orally consumed nicotine products not as medicine but as foodstuffs.<ref>{{cite book |last1= Kalkhoff|first1=Will|last2=Thye|first2=Shane R.|last3=Lawler|first3=Edward J.|date=|year=2012|chapter=The Birth of Medicinal Nicotine|title= Critical Perspectives on Addiction |edition=1st|page=79|publisher= Emerald Group Publishing |isbn=1780529317|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=8WxycrG-j1UC&pg=PA63&dq=#v=onepage&q&f=false }}</ref>
On January 13, 1984 Nicorette chewing gum was approved by the US [[Food and Drug Administration]] after a 34-month review. It was brought to the US market by [[Marion Merrell Dow]] under licence from AB Leo.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.pharmamedtechbi.com/publications/the-pink-sheet/46/004/merrell-dow-nicorette-antismoking-rx-chewing-gum-trade-shipments |title=Merrell Dow Nicorette Anti-Smoking Rx Chewing Gum Trade Shipments |date=1984-01-23 |year= |website= |series= |publisher=The Pink Sheet |location= |page= |pages= |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6VNPO9iE4?url=https://www.pharmamedtechbi.com/publications/the-pink-sheet/46/004/merrell-dow-nicorette-antismoking-rx-chewing-gum-trade-shipments |archivedate=2015-01-06 |accessdate=2015-01-05 |quote= |ref= |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
In 2016 it was the third biggest selling branded over-the-counter medication sold in Great Britain, with sales of £66.0 million.<ref>{{cite news|title=A breakdown of the over-the-counter medicines market in Britain in 2016|url=http://www.pharmaceutical-journal.com/20202662.article?amp;utm_medium=email&|accessdate=29 May 2017|publisher=Pharmaceutical Journal|date=28 April 2017}}</ref>
=== Further product === [[File:Nicorette Nasal Spray.jpg|thumb|Nicorette Nasal spray]] [[File:Nicorette Inhalator.jpg|thumb|Nicorette inhaler]] The Nicorette [[Nicotine patch|Patch]] was introduced to the market in 1991<ref>{{cite news| url = https://www.nytimes.com/1991/08/22/business/company-news-nicotine-patch-marketing-deals.html| title = COMPANY NEWS; Nicotine Patch Marketing Deals| date = 1991-08-22| publisher = [[The New York Times]]| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20150101202020/http://www.nytimes.com/1991/08/22/business/company-news-nicotine-patch-marketing-deals.html| archivedate = 2015-01-01| accessdate = 2015-01-01}}</ref> and the nasal spray in 1994.<ref name="super" />
In 1996 the FDA approved the switch of Nicorette gum and the NicoDerm CQ transdermal nicotine patch to [[Over-the-counter drug|over-the-counter]] status in the US.<ref name="fdaover">{{cite web|url=http://www.fda.gov/drugs/resourcesforyou/consumers/ucm143547.htm |title=Now Available Without a Prescription |date=2011-08-12 |publisher=[[Food and Drug Administration]] |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Vg8ScI93?url=http://www.fda.gov/drugs/resourcesforyou/consumers/ucm143547.htm |archivedate=2015-01-18 |accessdate=2015-01-18 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
The Nicorette inhaler was launched in 1996<ref name="super">{{cite web|url=http://www.superbrands.com/se/en/book/pdf/Superbrandsboken2010_Nicorette.pdf |title=Nicorette |year=2010 |publisher=[[Superbrands]] |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6VLoRAYA4?url=http://www.superbrands.com/se/en/book/pdf/Superbrandsboken2010_Nicorette.pdf |archivedate=2015-01-05 |accessdate=2015-01-18 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> and Nicorette Microtab ([[Sublingual administration|sublingual tablets]]) in 1999.<ref>{{cite web| url = http://business.highbeam.com/409991/article-1G1-53638193/pu-launches-sublingual-nrt| title = P&U launches sublingual NRT| date = 1999-01-16 | publisher = [[Chemist + Druggist]]| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20150101194952/http://business.highbeam.com/409991/article-1G1-53638193/pu-launches-sublingual-nrt| archivedate = 2015-01-01| accessdate = 2015-01-01| quote =}}</ref>
In 2002 the FDA changed the status of Commit lozenges to over the counter in the US.<ref name="fdaover" />
In 2004 Nicorette launched Peppermint, the first coated nicotine gum.<ref name="super" /> A shell coating containing a sugar substitute ([[xylitol]]) and flavouring masks the nicotine taste.<ref> {{cite journal |last=Prashant |first=K. Pagare |last2=Chandrakant |first2=S. Satpute |last3=Varsha |first3=M. Jadhav |last4=Vilasrao |first4=Kadam |date=2012-06-23 |title=Medicated Chewing Gum: A Novel Drug Delivery System |url=http://www.japsonline.com/admin/php/uploads/544_pdf.pdf |journal=Journal of Applied Pharmaceutical Science |publisher= |volume=02 |issue=06 |pages=40–54 |bibcode= |doi=10.7324/JAPS.2012.2706 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6VgClVfOf?url=http://www.japsonline.com/admin/php/uploads/544_pdf.pdf |archivedate=2015-01-18 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite book|editor-last=Gad|editor-first=Shayne Cox| year=2008|chapter=|title= Pharmaceutical Manufacturing Handbook: Production and Processes|edition=|url=https://books.google.ru/books?id=4c0Hp3AOi8UC&pg=PA259&dq=#v=onepage&q&f=false|publisher= John Wiley & Sons|isbn=978-0-470-25980-1|page=259 }}</ref> In 2005 Nicorette introduced Fresh Mint chewing gum.<ref>{{cite book|last1= Hendrix|first1=Jerry|last2=Hayes|first2=Darrell| year=2009|chapter=Exhibit 8-4a |title=Public Relations Cases|edition=8|page=300|publisher= Cengage Learning |isbn=0495567787|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=1TkC8r1I3asC&pg=PA300&dq=#v=onepage&q&f=false}}</ref>
In December 2008 Nicorette introduced a new semi-transparent nicotine patch under the trade name "Invisipatch".<ref name="invisi">{{cite web|url=http://www.mhra.gov.uk/home/groups/l-unit1/documents/websiteresources/con036311.pdf |title=Nicorette Invisi 10mg, 15mg, 25mg patches - PL 15513/0159-61 |date=2008-12-02 |publisher=[[Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency]] (UK) |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6VEDBuDH9?url=http://www.mhra.gov.uk/home/groups/l-unit1/documents/websiteresources/con036311.pdf |archivedate=2014-12-31 |accessdate=2014-12-31 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> As stated by the UK [[Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency]], in addition to this more discreet patch to encourage better customer compliance, new Nicorette transdermal patches have been developed to: reduce patch size; add a higher dosage strength of 25 mg of nicotine to the previously available 5, 10 and 15 mg; and increase the proportion of bioavailable nicotine).<ref name="invisi" />
In 2009 Nicorette introduced "Icy White" chewing gum with teeth whitening<ref>{{cite news| url = http://metro.co.uk/2009/09/30/gum-ad-screened-during-the-simpsons-inappropriate-451929/| title = Gum ad screened during The Simpsons ‘inappropriate’| date = 2009-09-30| publisher = [[Metro (British newspaper)|Metro]]| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20150101192001/http://metro.co.uk/2009/09/30/gum-ad-screened-during-the-simpsons-inappropriate-451929/| archivedate = 2015-01-01| accessdate = 2015-01-01}}</ref> and Nicorette Mentolmint, a chewing gum with softer [[menthol]] taste.<ref name="super" />
At the end of November 2010 Nicorette introduced QuickMist 1 mg [[Aerosol spray|mouthspray]],<ref name="quickm">{{cite web|url=http://www.mhra.gov.uk/home/groups/par/documents/websiteresources/con194682.pdf |title=Nicorette Quickmist 1mg/spray Mouthspray - PL 15513/0357 |date=2010-11-30 |publisher=[[Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency]] |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6VEGXo9GU?url=http://www.mhra.gov.uk/home/groups/par/documents/websiteresources/con194682.pdf |archivedate=2014-12-31 |accessdate=2014-12-31 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> which provides more rapid absorption of nicotine than lozenges or gum.<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/psb.776/pdf |title=Nicorette QuickMist: rapidly absorbed NRT mouthspray |last1=Chaplin |first1=Steve |publisher=Prescriber |volume=22 |issue=13–14 |date=July 2011 |location= |pages=26–28 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6VEGoQSD9?url=http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/psb.776/pdf |archivedate=2014-12-31 |quote= |ref= |doi=10.1002/psb.776 |journal=Prescriber |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
In January 2011 Nicorette UK launched the ActiveStop [[mobile app]] for [[iOS]] featuring target setting, a wish list, distractions, achievement sharing, information and games.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.latestgadgets.co.uk/apps-software/2701-nicorettes-activestop-iphone-app |title=Nicorette's ActiveStop anti-cigarette iPhone app |last1=Ratcliffe |first1=Jack |date=2011-01-05 |publisher=Latestgadgets.co.uk |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6VEAUnNJo?url=http://www.latestgadgets.co.uk/apps-software/2701-nicorettes-activestop-iphone-app |archivedate=2014-12-31 |accessdate=2014-12-31 |quote= |ref= |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url = http://metro.co.uk/2011/03/09/new-iphone-app-launched-to-help-smokers-quit-643469/| title = New iPhone app launched to help smokers quit| date = 2011-03-09| publisher = [[Metro (British newspaper)|Metro]]| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20141231085414/http://metro.co.uk/2011/03/09/new-iphone-app-launched-to-help-smokers-quit-643469/| archivedate = 2014-12-31| accessdate = 2014-12-31| quote =| ref =}}</ref>
== Brand communication ==
=== Yacht race sponsorship === Nicorette has been sponsoring [[yacht racing]] since 1993<ref name="racing">{{cite web|url=http://www.racingandsports.com.au/en/sports/-story-54295 |title=New super maxi a smoke-free zone: Ludde Ingvall reckons his new super maxi Nicorette goes so fast you can almost see the hull smoking |last1=Coomber |first1=John |date=2004-12-23 |year= |website=http://www.racingandsports.com.au |series= |publisher=Racing and Sports |location= |page= |pages= |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6VnsFGKSF?url=http://www.racingandsports.com.au/en/sports/-story-54295 |archivedate=2015-01-23 |accessdate=2015-01-23 |quote= |ref= |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> when it partnered with [[Ludde Ingvall]], a Finnish-born Swede who started a non-smoking team in 1991.<ref name="racing" />
{{pull quote|The tobacco companies were ousted from land-based sports due to legislation that stopped them from promoting themselves in other sports… They all realized that yachting is in international waters, under a totally different legal framework, and they all started to sponsor yachts… I was absolutely furious when yachts (with names of tobacco companies) started arriving on the scene… I thought it was unfair that they were using my sport. It's a green sport, it's a healthy sport ... it is not a sport to be hijacked.|author=Ludde Ingvall|source=in an article<ref name="racing" />}}
In 1995 the Nicorette team was banned from the [[South Atlantic Race|Cape to Rio Race]], sponsored by the tobacco company [[Rothmans International|Rothmans]]. The captain of “Nicorette” protested against the decision, saying that “Rothmans is scared of the boat and the healthy lifestyle it seeks to promote”.<ref>{{cite book|last1= Coakley|first1=Jay J.|last2=Dunning|first2=Eric|year=2000|chapter=Sport and Health|title= Handbook of Sports Studies|edition=1st|page=411|publisher=SAGE|isbn=1446224686|url= https://books.google.com/books?id=LwrybUaytDUC&pg=PA411&lpg=#v=onepage&q&f=false |accessdate=2015-01-23}}(Google Books)</ref> A spokesperson for the organizing committee of the race later admitted that the yacht was barred because they considered the product to be in competition with the sponsor's product.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.who.int/tobacco/media/ROSS2000X.pdf |title=Tobacco Advertising & Promotion: The Need for a Coordinated Global Response |last1=Hammond |first1=Ross |date=2000-01-07 |year= |website= |series= |publisher=[[World Health Organization]] |location=New Delhi |page= |pages= |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Vnuxvg4g?url=http://www.who.int/tobacco/media/ROSS2000X.pdf |archivedate=2015-01-23 |accessdate=2015-01-23 |quote= |ref= |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> In the same year the yacht won the [[Fastnet Race]].
In 1997 the yacht broke the [[Transatlantic sailing record|Transatlantic mono-hull record]], covering the route from [[New York City]] to [[Lizard Point, Cornwall|Lizard Point]] ([[Great Britain]]) in 11 days 13:22.58.<ref>{{cite web| url = https://www.nytimes.com/1998/07/08/sports/plus-yacht-racing-frenchman-breaks-trans-atlantic-mark.html| title = PLUS: YACHT RACING; Frenchman Breaks Trans-Atlantic Mark| date = 1998-07-08| year =| website = | series =| publisher = [[The New York Times]]| location = | page =| pages =| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20150123212123/http://www.nytimes.com/1998/07/08/sports/plus-yacht-racing-frenchman-breaks-trans-atlantic-mark.html| archivedate = 2015-01-23| accessdate = 2015-01-23| quote =| ref =}}</ref> Second and third generations of the yacht won the [[Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race]] in 2000<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/sport/story/0,3604,416020,00.html |title=Rough rider Nicorette takes Sydney-Hobart |last1=Tait |first1=Paul |date=2000-12-29 |year= |website= |series= |publisher=[[The Guardian]] |location= |page= |pages= |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Vo2wbKNV?url=http://www.theguardian.com/sport/story/0,3604,416020,00.html |archivedate=2015-01-23 |accessdate=2015-01-23 |quote= |ref= |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> and 2004.
=== Car race sponsorship === [[File:Jeff Gordon Nicorette Richmond 2008.jpg|thumb|Jeff Gordon Nicorette DuPont race car]] During the 90s Nicorette ([[GlaxoSmithKline]]) has been sponsoring [[Dennis Vitolo]] (ex-smoker) in [[Dale Coyne Racing|Payton Coyne Racing]]<ref>{{cite web| url = http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-83942352.html| title = MOTOR SPORTS : DRIVING OFF TOBACCO ROAD.(SPORTS)| last1 = Schlotter| first1 = Bill| date = 1997-09-26| year =| website =| series =| publisher = [[Los Angeles Daily News]]| location =| page =| pages =| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20150101205825/http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-83942352.html| archivedate = 2015-01-01| accessdate = 2015-01-01| quote =| ref =}}</ref> and [[Grand Prix of Miami (open wheel racing)|The Grand Prix of Miami]].<ref>{{cite web| url = http://www.newsweek.com/choosing-politics-over-policy-163674| title = MARKETING: Breaking Away From the Packs| date = 1999-03-29| year =| website =| series =| publisher = [[Newsweek]]| location =| page =| pages =| accessdate = | quote =| ref =}}</ref> In 2005 the brand entered [[NASCAR]] race sponsorship with [[Casey Mears]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://sports.espn.go.com/rpm/news/story?id=1977186 |title=NASCAR leaves smoking days farther behind |date=2005-01-27 |year= |website= |series= |publisher=[[ESPN]] |location= |page= |pages= |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150108102927/http://sports.espn.go.com/rpm/news/story?id=1977186 |archivedate=2015-01-08 |accessdate=2015-01-01 |quote= |ref= |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref name="usatoday">{{cite web|url=http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/money/advertising/2005-01-26-nascar-usat_x.htm |title=Nicorette, NASCAR sign sponsorship deal |last1=Horovitz |first1=Bruce |date=2005-01-26 |year= |website= |series= |publisher=[[USA Today]] |location= |page= |pages= |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6VGUpItTu?url=http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/money/advertising/2005-01-26-nascar-usat_x.htm |archivedate=2015-01-01 |accessdate=2015-01-01 |quote= |ref= |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Since 2006 Nicorette is sponsoring [[Hendrick Motorsports]] with [[Jeff Gordon]]'s car.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hendrickmotorsports.com/news/article/2005/10/14/Nicorette-to-Join-No-24-Team-in-2006 |title=Nicorette to Join No. 24 Team in 2006 |date=2005-10-14 |year= |website= |series= |publisher=Hendrickmotorsports.com |location= |page= |pages= |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6VGVV4ck8?url=http://www.hendrickmotorsports.com/news/article/2005/10/14/Nicorette-to-Join-No-24-Team-in-2006 |archivedate=2015-01-01 |accessdate=2015-01-01 |quote= |ref= |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> The brand also runs the Nicorette's Quit Crew program to help racers quit smoking.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://savannahnow.com/sports/2007-04-10/nicorette-gum-helps-nascar-shift-gear-smoking-sponsors |title=Nicorette gum helps NASCAR shift gear on smoking sponsors |last1=Coble |first1=Don |date=2007-04-10 |year= |website= |series= |publisher=[[Savannah Morning News]] |location= |page= |pages= |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6VGVekRDw?url=http://savannahnow.com/sports/2007-04-10/nicorette-gum-helps-nascar-shift-gear-smoking-sponsors |archivedate=2015-01-01 |accessdate=2015-01-01 |quote= |ref= |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
It has been reported that apparently the brand is supporting car races because NASCAR fans are heavy smokers.<ref name="usatoday" /> {{Clear}}

Nicorette Quit Support] * [http://www.nicorette.co.uk/ Nicorette UK]

'''Pharmaceutical publication planning''' is the activity of planning the dissemination of scientific and clinical data on a [[drug]] to [[Health care provider#Practitioners and professionals |healthcare professional]]s at [[Congress#Scientific congress |scientific congresses]] and medical society meetings and in [[peer review]]ed [[Public health journal|medical journals]].
==Procedure==
Pharmaceutical publication planning involves developing a detailed plan that outlines the timely presentation of verified scientific and clinical data to appropriate types of healthcare professionals such as [[physician]]s, [[pharmacist]]s, [[nurse]]s, as a drug undergoes [[clinical trial]]s and after it is [[Marketing|marketed]]. Because of scientific and therapeutic advances, pharmaceutical publication planning has become a well-established and important function by [[Pharmaceutical industry|pharmaceutical companies]] in order to educate healthcare professionals accordingly about new drugs and marketed drugs with new [[Clinical significance|clinical uses]] or [[safety]] information.
Within pharmaceutical companies, publication planning is usually overseen by medical or clinical affairs professionals. In this effort, pharmaceutical companies frequently use the assistance of medical communication agencies with publication planning expertise and professional [[Medical writing|medical writers]].
==Medical communication agencies==
Medical communication agencies include a broad range of organizations, including those that focus largely or exclusively on publication planning. When developing and executing a publication plan on behalf of a pharmaceutical or [[biotechnology]] client, medical communication agencies employ professional publication strategists, scientific medical directors, medical writers and project managers. Working as a team, this group of individuals delves deep into their client's scientific discoveries, and propose the most effective and efficient ways to spread the word about new potential therapies to physicians and other healthcare providers.
There has been some discussion in the [[Media (communication)|media]] regarding disclosure as it pertains to the use of [[medical writing|professional medical writers]] in this endeavor. Some agencies and professional organizations focused on publication planning have been and continue to develop and refine [[Ethics|ethical]] guidelines and standards for disclosure and transparency.
== Professional publication planning associations == Professional organizations for individuals involved in pharmaceutical publication planning include the [[International Society of Medical Publication Professionals]] (ISMPP) <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ismpp.org|title=ISMPP Home|author=MemberClicks Admin|work=ismpp.org|accessdate=4 March 2015}}</ref> and [[The International Publication Planning Association]] (TIPPA).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://publicationplanningassociation.org|title=Healthcare Education Associates|work=publicationplanningassociation.org|accessdate=4 March 2015}}</ref> The purpose of these organizations is to create a forum where individuals involved with pharmaceutical publication planning and [[Medical research|biomedical]] publications can meet and share knowledge and experience. They serve to promote career opportunities and [[professional development]] of individuals involved with pharmaceutical publication planning, as well as to promote standards of excellence in ethical professional medical writing and the biomedical publication process in disseminating scientific and clinical data on pharmaceutical products.
In 2009, ISMPP began a certification program for publication planning professionals.
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * [http://ismpp.memberclicks.net/assets/docs/Inititives/advocacy/the_rationale_and_value_of_medical_publications.pdf The Rationale and Value of Medical Publications] * [http://medicine.plosjournals.org/perlserv/?request=get-document&doi=10.1371%2Fjournal.pmed.0040286&ct=1&SESSID=56668dee3a5b9f3ce5fa7106c6ad273a Ghost Management: How Much of the Medical Literature Is Shaped Behind the Scenes by the Pharmaceutical Industry?] from [[PLoS Medicine]] * [http://ismpp.memberclicks.net/assets/docs/Inititives/GPP2/gpp-2_2009.pdf Good publication practice for communicating company sponsored medical research: the GPP2 guidelines] * [http://www.icmje.org/ International Committee of Medical Journal Editors] * [http://www.wame.org/ World Association of Medical Editors] * [http://www.amwa.org/default.asp?Mode=DirectoryDisplay&id=1&DirectoryUseAbsoluteOnSearch=True American Medical Writers Association] * [http://www.emwa.org/ European Medical Writers Association] * [http://www.publicationethics.org/ Committee on Publication Ethics]

The '''Private Health Insurance Ombudsman'''<ref>[http://www.phio.org.au Private Health Insurance Ombudsman (PHIO)]</ref> is an [[List of Australian government entities|Australian Government agency]] but acts independently of the government in investigating complaints involving private [[health insurance]] and reporting.<ref>[http://www.healthdirectory.com.au/Health_insurance/ Health Directory]</ref> The role and functions of the office are contained in Sections 230- 256 of the ''Private Health Insurance Act 2007''.<ref>[http://www.comlaw.gov.au/ComLaw/Legislation/Act1.nsf/all\whatsnew/11f4c084ee9c11d4ca2572b200133b47?OpenDocument&Click= Private Health Insurance Act 2007]</ref>
==Role and functions== The office protects the interests of people who are covered by private health insurance<ref>[http://www.phio.org.au/downloads/file/aboutphio/statementexpectations.pdf Statement of Expectations from Australian Minister of Health Nicola Roxon, 25 May 2009]</ref><ref>[http://www.phio.org.au/downloads/file/aboutphio/statementintent.pdf Statement of Intent from Samantha Gavel, 9 July 2009, in response to Nicola Roxon's Statement of Expectations]</ref> by investigating complaints and assisting in the resolution of complaints.<ref>[http://www.phiac.gov.au/for-consumers/frequently-asked-questions/ [[Private Health Insurance Administration Council]] website, retrieved 20 February 2012]</ref> It also publishes independent information about private health insurance and the performance of health funds.<ref>[http://www.phio.org.au/publications/publications/annual-reports.aspx PHIO's Annual Reports] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160106181338/http://www.phio.org.au/publications/publications/annual-reports.aspx |date=2016-01-06 }}</ref> According to the [[Government of Australia|Australian Government's]] website, the [[ombudsman]] "provides private health insurance members with an independent service for health insurance problems and enquiries."<ref>[http://australia.gov.au/directories/australia/phio Australian Government site]</ref>
The office has stated that it expects to fulfill this role by handling complaints in a high quality manner; by providing information and advice to consumers; and by providing information, advice, and recommendations to the Government.<ref>[http://www.phio.org.au/downloads/file/aboutphio/statementintent.pdf Statement of Intent, 9 July 2009]</ref>
==History== Originally, the Private Health Insurance Ombudsman was established on 4 March 1996 as the Private Health Insurance Complaints Commission (PHICC).<ref>[http://www.aph.gov.au/senate/Committee/clac_ctte/completed_inquiries/1996-99/health/report/c04.htm Australian Senate: THE REVIEW OF THE HEALTH LEGISLATION (PRIVATE HEALTH INSURANCE REFORM) AMENDMENT ACT 1995]</ref> The name was changed in 1998.<ref>[http://www.health.gov.au/internet/main/publishing.nsf/Content/health-pubs-budget99-pbs-partc_3.htm 1999-2000 Budget Department of Health & Ageing Outcome 3]</ref>
On 1 July 2015, the Private Health Insurance Ombudsman merged with the [[Commonwealth Ombudsman]], as part of the smaller government measures in the [[2014 Australian federal budget|2014 federal budget]].<ref name=merger>[http://www.health.gov.au/internet/main/publishing.nsf/content/health-phicirculars2015-02 Appointment of Acting Private Health Insurance Ombudsman]</ref>
==Ombudsman officeholders== Samantha Gavel was appointed Ombudsman on 1 April 2008 for a three-year term.<ref>[http://www.health.gov.au/internet/ministers/publishing.nsf/Content/mr-yr08-nr-nr050.htm Media Release: Minister for Health & Ageing]</ref> Gavel held the position until she was appointed [[National Health Practitioner Ombudsman and Privacy Commissioner]] in January 2015.<ref>[http://austphi.tumblr.com/post/104356813844/samantha-gavel-current-phio-has-been-appointed Samantha Gavel, current PHIO has been appointed National Health Practitioner Ombudsman and Privacy Commissioner]</ref> David McGregor was appointed acting Private Health Insurance Ombudsman until 30 June 2015, when the Private Health Insurance Ombudsman was merged with the Commonwealth Ombudsman.<ref name=merger/>
==See also== *[[Healthcare in Australia]]
==References== {{reflist}}

The '''Sanctuary of Oropa''' ({{lang-it|santuario di Oropa}}), is a group of [[Roman Catholic]] buildings and structures in the municipality of [[Biella]], [[Italy]]. It is located at a height of 1,159 metres in a small valley of the [[Alpi Biellesi]].<ref>CTR (''Carta Tecnica Regionale'') 1:10.000, Regione Piemonte, Settore Cartografico and Settore Sistema Informativo Territoriale, 2007 [[Raster graphics|raster]] version</ref>
== History == [[File:Santuario di Oropa-chiesa nuova-complesso1.jpg|thumb|left|The Upper Basilica]] According to legend, a [[black Virgin of Oropa|black wooden statue]] of the [[Virgin Mary]] carved by [[Saint Luke]] was found in [[Jerusalem]] by Saint [[Eusebius of Vercelli]] and carried to Oropa in the 4th century AD<ref name = atl>''The sanctuary of Oropa'', [[province of Biella]] tourist office; web page on [http://www.atl.biella.it/en/santuario-di-oropa www.atl.biella.it] (accessed in February 2014)</ref> and placed into a small niche in a big boulder. Around that niche housing the [[Black Virgin of Oropa|statue]] in the [[Middle Ages]] was built first a church, which during the early 17th century was replaced with what is known today as the Ancient Basilica. In the following two centuries several other buildings were added to the complex, including the royal apartments of the [[House of Savoy]], a big library and the Royal Gate, a masterpiece designed by the architect [[Filippo Juvarra]] in the 18th century.<ref name = atl />
The last building added to the sanctuary was the Upper Basilica, a monumental church built between 1885 and 1960 due the large number of pilgrims visiting Oropa.<ref>''History of the sanctuary'', official web-site [http://www.santuariodioropa.it/db/en/history-culture/history-of-the-sanctuary www.santuariodioropa.it] (accessed in February 2014)</ref> Its dome is 80 metres high and the church can hold 3000 people.<ref>''Santuario diOropa (BI)'', on [http://www.camperontheroad.it/Pellegrinando/Oropa/Santuario%20di%20Oropa.pdf www.camperontheroad.it] (accessed in February 2014)</ref>
In 1617, the construction of the [[Sacro Monte di Oropa]] (literally Sacred Mount of Oropa) was built not far from the sanctuary. It is a [[Catholic devotions|devotional]] path now composed of twelve [[chapel]]s (plus another seven nearby) containing groups of statues representing scenes from the story of the [[Virgin Mary]]'s life.
Near the Sacro Monte in the 19th century was built a new graveyard, where the noble families of the Biellese territory built their family tombs. Some graves have [[free masons]] symbols, such as [[Quintino Sella]]'s one.
== Devotion and popular beliefs == The statue of the black Madonna has always been venerated and to the Virgin of Oropa are attributed miracles and protections. The town of Biella made a vow during the 17th-century plague and it wasn't infected. Following this grace, the town does a pilgrimage every year to the sanctuary in order to thank the Virgin Mary.
People during the centuries made '''[[ex-voto]]''' (for grace) pictures to thank the Virgin Mary. All of these pictures are still preserved in the sanctuary in the 'ex voto gallery'. The oldest picture dates back to 1522 and was made by painter [[Bernardino Lanino]].
The popular belief says that the wooden statue has some peculiar characteristics: * despite the age of the statue it has no woodworm;<ref>{{cite book|last1=Trompetto|first1=Massimo|title=Storia del Santuario di Oropa|date=1993|location=Biella|pages=20–25}}</ref> * the foot, despite the ancient tradition of touching it for good luck, is not worn out;<ref>{{cite web|title = Santuario di Oropa (IV secolo) - Patrimonio dell’Umanità (UNESCO) | url=http://www.reginamundi.info/SantuarioDiOropa/|website=reginamundi.info|accessdate=11 June 2015}}</ref> * dust does not settle on the faces of the Virgin and of the Baby.<ref>{{cite web| title = Il mistero della "Madonna bruna" | author = Roberto Allegri | url=http://www.tonyassante.com/baglioni/2004/fausta2/ilfaustino/renzo/oropa/indice.htm|website=tonyassant.com|accessdate=11 June 2015}}</ref>
== Pilgrimages == Around 800,000 [[pilgrim]]s and one-hundred pilgrimages visit the sanctuary each year.<ref name = atl />
The evocative and ancient pilgrimage from [[Fontainemore]] to Oropa takes place every five years.
== Nature conservation == [[File:Funivia oropa sfondo santuario.jpg|thumb|View from the ''Oropa-lago del Mucrone'' cableway]] The mountain area surrounding the sanctuary is included in a [[regional park]] of 1,518.28 [[hectares|ha]] (code: EUAP0882) named ''Riserva Naturale Speciale del Sacro Monte di Oropa''.<ref>''Riserva Naturale Speciale del Sacro Monte di Oropa'', description on [http://www.parks.it/riserva.sacro.monte.oropa/par.php www.parks.it] (accessed in February 2014)</ref>
== Sports ==
=== Cycling === The Sanctuary has been the end of a stage of the [[Giro d'Italia]] six times. {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%;width:750px;" !Year !Stage !Date !Track !km !Winner !Leader general classification |- |align=center|[[Giro d'Italia 1963|1963]]||11ª||29 May||[[Asti]] > Santuario di Oropa||align=center|130||{{flagicon|ITA}} [[Vito Taccone]]||{{flagicon|ITA}} [[Diego Ronchini]] |- |align=center|[[Giro d'Italia 1993|1993]]||20ª||11 June||[[Torino]] > Santuario di Oropa||align=center|162||{{flagicon|ITA}} [[Massimo Ghirotto]]||{{flagicon|ESP}} [[Miguel Indurain]] |- |align=center|[[1999 Giro d'Italia|1999]]||15ª||30 May||[[Racconigi]] > Santuario di Oropa||align=center|160||{{flagicon|ITA}} [[Marco Pantani]]||{{flagicon|ITA}} [[Marco Pantani]] |- |align=center|[[Giro d'Italia 2007|2007]]||13ª||25 May||[[Biella]] > Santuario di Oropa ''(cron. individuale)''||align=center|12,6||{{flagicon|ITA}} [[Marzio Bruseghin]]||{{flagicon|ITA}} [[Danilo Di Luca]] |- |align="center"|[[Giro d'Italia 2014|2014]]||14ª||24 May||[[Agliè]] > [[Oropa]]||align=center|184||{{Flagicon|ITA}} [[Enrico Battaglin]]||{{Flagicon|COL}} [[Rigoberto Urán]] |- |align="center"|[[Giro d'Italia 2017|2017]]||14ª||20 May||[[Castellania, Piedmont|Castellania]] > [[Oropa]]||align=center|131|| {{Flagicon|NED}} [[Tom Dumoulin]]||{{Flagicon|NED}} [[Tom Dumoulin]] |}

{{Orphan|date=December 2012}}
'''The Diversity Foundation''', also known as '''Smiles for Diversity''', is a [[Non-profit organization|nonprofit organization]] started by Dr. Dan Fischer, who was raised in the polygamous community of the [[Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints]] and who is a former member of the FLDS church.<ref name=autogenerated2>[http://www.religionnewsblog.com/11455/boulder-author-aims-to-find-sect-leader Boulder author aims to find sect leader<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
The Diversity Foundation is a registered [[501(c)(3)]] organization. The Foundation's mission is to strengthen and align global communities. This is accomplished by empowering vulnerable and [[underprivileged children]] with access to quality education. Through educational tools Diversity supports and encourages mindful awareness of the value of [[Multiculturalism|diversity]] and a respect of ethnic and [[cultural heritage]].
After the attack on a Jewish day-care center in California and the murder of gay University of Wyoming student [[Matthew Shepard]], Dan Fischer set up The Diversity Foundation to encourage [[dentists]] to promote respect for human diversity.<ref name=autogenerated1>{{cite web |url=http://www.childbrides.org/boys_sltrib_lost_boys.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2007-08-17 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070824182245/http://childbrides.org/boys_sltrib_lost_boys.html |archivedate=2007-08-24 |df= }}</ref>
The Diversity Foundations three-fold aim is to:
# Provide dental products to disadvantaged people # Encourage acceptance of diversity # Help the [[Lost Boys of Polygamy]]
Smiles for Diversity's primary method for encouraging acceptance of diversity is through the distribution of [[comic books]] and [[coloring book]]s. Part of The Diversity Foundation's charitable mission is to provide educational materials without charge to teachers and librarians.<ref name=autogenerated3>[http://www.silverbulletcomicbooks.com/features/11447815046798.htm Bill Galvan: From the Scrapyard to Riverdale<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303190840/http://www.silverbulletcomicbooks.com/features/11447815046798.htm |date=2016-03-03 }}</ref> The comic book is [[Scrapyard Detectives]], created by [[Bill Galvan]] and [[Chad Denton]], and was originally created as "a way for kids to get the message that being different is great, and diversity should be appreciated and celebrated.".<ref name=autogenerated3 /><ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20070929110933/http://www.comicon.com/cgi-bin/ultimatebb.cgi?ubb=get_topic;f=36;t=005879 Comicon.Com: Galvan & The Scrapyard Detectives<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
The Diversity Foundation attempts to help the [[Lost Boys of Polygamy]] by helping the boys get schooling and even college educations.<ref name=autogenerated1 /> They try to ""We try to find these kids, find them a place to live and help them with school."<ref name=autogenerated2 /> However The Diversity Foundation isn't familiar with all lost boys, because there are many who "slip through the cracks and do not get help once they leave Hildale or Colorado City. Some of them simply don't know what help is available."<ref>[http://www.deseretnews.com/article/1,5143,660210781,00.html Deseret Morning News | Accused man has ties to FLDS towns<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Fischer also wants to raise awareness about the Lost Boys.<ref>[http://www.childbrides.org/boys_LAT_lost_to_only_life_they_knew.html Lost to the Only Life They Knew<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071110102610/http://www.childbrides.org/boys_LAT_lost_to_only_life_they_knew.html |date=2007-11-10 }}</ref><ref>[http://articles.latimes.com/2008/jun/30/nation/na-fischer30 Los Angeles Times | Ex-polygamist Dan Fischer is a thorn in the side of FLDS<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
==External links== * [http://www.scrapyarddetectives.com Scrapyard Detectives] * [http://www.smilesfordiversity.org/ Official website]

{{about|an approach to prescribing medication|the bowel surgery known as the STEP procedure|serial transverse enteroplasty}} In [[managed care|managed medical care]] '''step therapy''' is an approach to [[medical prescription|prescription]] intended to control the costs and risks posed by [[prescription drug]]s. The practice begins [[medication]] for a medical condition with the most cost-effective drug therapy and progresses to other more costly or risky therapies only if necessary. Also called '''step protocol''' or a '''fail first requirement''', and is a type of [[prior authorization]] requirement.
Recent trends in prescription drug prices in the United States has led to an increased pressure on health care providers to keep down the cost of prescription medication while maintaining high levels of availability to the patient.<ref> Jessica S. Banthin, Peter Cunningham, and Didem M. Bernard "Financial Burden Of Health Care", 2001–2004 Health Affairs, January/February 2008; 27(1): 188-195.</ref> The use of [[generic drugs]] when possible allows health care plans to pursue both of these goals effectively.<ref>[http://www.ajmc.com/Article.cfm?Menu=1&ID=2650 Brenda R. Motheral, PhD; Rochelle Henderson, MPA; and Emily R. Cox, PhD "Investigation showing step therapy reduces managed care costs: Plan-Sponsor Savings and Member Experience With Point-of-Service Prescription Step Therapy", The American Journal of Managed Care Volume 10:457-464 July 2004 Number 7 Pt 1]</ref> Physicians and managed care providers may disagree on the proper step therapy<ref>Neil J. MacKinnon, Ph.D., R.Ph., Ritu Kumar, M.H.S.A., R.N., "Prior Authorization Programs: A Critical Review of the Literature", Journal of Managed Care Pharmacy 2001 Volume 7 Issue 4:297-303</ref> and patients are encouraged to become knowledgeable in managing their own care.
==Opponents== Opponents of step therapy, such as Fail First Hurts, have detailed the pitfalls of step therapy.<ref>[https://failfirsthurts.org/ffh/ FailFirstHurts.org]</ref> "Fail First is used by health insurers to control costs. It is time-consuming from a physician and patient standpoint, is more expensive from a direct and indirect out-of-pocket cost perspective, denies patients the drugs they need when they need them, and allows payers to practice medicine without a license." * Creates additional barriers leading people to forgo needed medications * Can cause patients’ medical conditions to deteriorate, increasing the need for medical intervention in the future. As a result, patients require increasingly costly medical care * Increases frustration and incidents of depression * Increases the risk of non-compliance and self-medication
==See also== * [[Prescription drug]] * [[Prescription drug prices in the United States]] * [[Managed Care]] * [[Health care in the United States]]
